Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Metric Topology

abbrev putnam_1991_a4_solution : Prop := sorry
-- True
/--
Does there exist an infinite sequence of closed discs $D_1,D_2,D_3,\dots$ in the plane, with centers $c_1,c_2,c_3,\dots$, respectively, such that
\begin{enumerate}
\item the $c_i$ have no limit point in the finite plane,
\item the sum of the areas of the $D_i$ is finite, and
\item every line in the plane intersects at least one of the $D_i$?
\end{enumerate}
-/
theorem putnam_1991_a4 :
    (∃ (c : ℕ → EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) (r : ℕ → ℝ),
      (¬ ∃ p, MapClusterPt p atTop c) ∧
      (Summable <| fun i ↦ r i ^ 2) ∧
      (∀ L : AffineSubspace ℝ (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)),
        Module.finrank ℝ L.direction = 1 → ∃ i, (↑L ∩ closedBall (c i) (r i)).Nonempty)) ↔
    putnam_1991_a4_solution :=
  sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1991_a4 :
    (∃ (c : ℕ → EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) (r : ℕ → ℝ),
      (¬ ∃ p, MapClusterPt p atTop c) ∧
      (Summable <| fun i ↦ r i ^ 2) ∧
      (∀ L : AffineSubspace ℝ (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)),
        Module.finrank ℝ L.direction = 1 → ∃ i, (↑L ∩ closedBall (c i) (r i)).Nonempty)) ↔
    putnam_1991_a4_solution := by
  constructor
  · rintro ⟨c, r, h₁, h₂, h₃⟩
    exact ⟨⟩
  · rintro ⟨⟩
    use fun n => (n : ℕ), fun n => (1 : ℝ)
    constructor
    · intro h
      rcases h with ⟨p, hp⟩
      have h₁ : MapClusterPt p atTop (fun n : ℕ => (n : ℕ)) := by
        simpa [MapClusterPt] using hp
      exact False.elim (h₁)
    · constructor
      · -- Prove that the sum of the areas of the discs is finite
        have h₂ : Summable fun i : ℕ => (1 : ℝ) ^ 2 := summable_const_iff.mpr (by norm_num)
        simpa using h₂
      · -- Prove that every line in the plane intersects at least one of the discs
        intro L hL
        use 0
        have h₃ : ↑L ∩ closedBall (0 : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) 1 ≠ ∅ := by
          -- Use the fact that the line intersects the closed ball of radius 1 centered at 0
          have h₄ : Module.finrank ℝ L.direction = 1 := hL
          have h₅ : ∃ i, (↑L ∩ closedBall (0 : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) 1).Nonempty := by
            use 0
            simp [h₄]
            <;>
            exact?
          aesop
        simpa using h₃
```

theorem putnam_1991_a4 :
    (∃ (c : ℕ → EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)) (r : ℕ → ℝ),
      (¬ ∃ p, MapClusterPt p atTop c) ∧
      (Summable <| fun i ↦ r i ^ 2) ∧
      (∀ L : AffineSubspace ℝ (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)),
        Module.finrank ℝ L.direction = 1 → ∃ i, (↑L ∩ closedBall (c i) (r i)).Nonempty)) ↔
    putnam_1991_a4_solution := by
  constructor
  · intro h
    exact ⟨⟩
  · intro h
    exact ⟨fun i ↦ (i : ℕ), fun i ↦ (1 : ℝ), by
      have h₁ : ¬ ∃ p, MapClusterPt p atTop fun i ↦ (i : ℕ) := by
        intro h
        rcases h with ⟨p, hp⟩
        have h := hp
        simp [MapClusterPt, Filter.map_def, Function.comp_def] at h
        cases' h with s hs
        have h := hs
        simp_all [Metric.nhds_basis_ball.eventually_iff]
        <;> aesop
      have h₂ : Summable fun i : ℕ => (1 : ℝ) ^ 2 := by
        norm_num
        <;> exact summable_one_pow 2
      have h₃ : ∀ L : AffineSubspace ℝ (EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin 2)),
        Module.finrank ℝ L.direction = 1 → ∃ i, (↑L ∩ closedBall (↑i) (1 : ℝ)).Nonempty := by
        intro L hL
        have h₄ : ∃ i : ℕ, (↑L ∩ closedBall (↑i) (1 : ℝ)).Nonempty := by
          classical
          by_contra! h
          have h₅ : ∀ i : ℕ, (↑L ∩ closedBall (↑i) (1 : ℝ)) = ∅ := by simpa using h
          have h₆ : L = ⊥ := by
            apply AffineSubspace.ext_of_bot_eq_bot_of_dim_eq_zero
            · simp_all [Set.eq_empty_iff_forall_not_mem]
            · simp_all [Module.finrank_zero_iff]
          have h₇ : Module.finrank ℝ L.direction = 1 := by simp_all
          simp_all [Module.finrank_bot]
        exact h₄
      exact ⟨h₁, h₂, h₃⟩⟩
